verses.text: 準繩的異象我又舉目觀看，看見一人手裡拿著量度用的繩子。

words.note: A rope or line used for measuring or ensuring straightness.
More formal and attentive than '看'.
More formal than '量'.
Refers to a specific verse in scripture.
Standard Hebrew text of the Old Testament.

verses.text: 我問他：「你到哪裡去？」他對我說：「我要去量度耶路撒冷，看看有多寬，有多長。」

words.note: More formal than '量'.
Reduplication implies a try or casual action.

verses.text: 那與我說話的天使離去的時候，另有一位天使迎著他來，

words.note: Forms an adverbial phrase with '時候'.

verses.text: 對他說：「你快跑去告訴那年輕人：『耶路撒冷必有人居住，像沒有城牆規限的田野，因為城中的人和牲畜很多。
耶和華說：我要作耶路撒冷四圍的火牆和城中的榮耀。』」

words.note: Metaphorical for divine protection.

verses.text: 呼召人民回歸故土「嗨！嗨！你們要從北方之地逃走（這是耶和華的宣告），因為我過去曾把你們分散在天的四方。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Often used in a religious context for God's call.
Classical possessive/modifying particle.
Marks the object that is disposed of or acted upon.

verses.text: 耶和華說：「嗨！與巴比倫的居民同住的錫安的人民哪！逃跑吧！」

words.note: Used at the end of a sentence for emphasis or address.
Indicates suggestion or a mild command.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華這樣說，得了榮耀之後，他差遣我去攻擊那些劫掠你們的列國，因為凡觸摸你們的，就是觸摸他眼中的瞳人。

words.note: A title for God meaning 'Lord of armies/heavenly hosts'.
Often used in religious contexts for divine sending.
Often refers to Gentile nations in biblical context.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who touch you'.
Lit. 'eye's person'; a common metaphor for something precious.

verses.text: 看哪！我要向他們揮動我的手，他們就必成了自己奴僕的掠物。這樣，你們就知道萬軍之耶和華差遣了我。

words.note: Common biblical interjection to draw attention.
Often used in biblical context for bondage or service.
A title for God meaning 'Lord of armies/heavenly hosts'.
Often used in religious contexts for divine sending.

verses.text: 「錫安的居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）哪！你們要歡呼快樂，因為我要來住在你們中間。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Here meaning 'is rendered as' or 'is written as'.
Used at the end of a sentence for emphasis or address.

verses.text: 到那日，許多國家要歸附耶和華，作他的（「他的」原文作「我的」）子民，他要（「他要」原文作「我要」）住在你們中間。你們就知道萬軍之耶和華差遣了我到你們那裡去。

words.note: Often implies allegiance or submission in a religious context.
Here, means 'is written as' or 'reads as'.
Often refers to God's chosen people.
Here, means 'is written as' or 'reads as'.
A divine title signifying God's power and sovereignty over all armies.
Often used for sending messengers or prophets.

verses.text: 耶和華必再得著猶大作他在聖地的業分，他必再揀選耶路撒冷。

words.note: Refers to an allocated share or heritage.

verses.text: 全人類都當在耶和華面前肅靜，因為他從自己聖潔的居所被激動起來了。

words.note: Implies a respectful or solemn silence.
Often refers to God's dwelling or temple.
A verb complement indicating a rising action or the beginning of an action.
